intro: Webbia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy webbia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes grass-like plants and some aquatic species. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy, strap-like leaves that are often bluish-green in color. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Webbia hirsuta is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
